results.title: College
results.creator_credit: James W. Horne, Buster Keaton, Joseph Schenck and Buster Keaton Productions
results.brief_description: Buster goes to college and becomes sports obsessed when his lady love considers him less than manly. Spending a fortune on every imaginable piece of sporting apparatus, Buster is determined to muscle his way into her affections. This film is representative of Keatons madcap antics and incredible stunts with a grand comic finale which will leave the audience reeling.

results.title: Blood and sand
results.creator_credit: Fred Niblo, Jesse L Lasky and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Rudolph Valentino is Juan Gallardo, a poor boy who realises his ambition to become one of Spain’s greatest matadors. When he marries his childhood sweetheart it seems as if his dreams will be fulfilled, but he soon falls prey to a seductress. Ultimately, Gallardo is defeated as much by his own conduct as by the events in the arena. This Valentino feature prompted a series of films about bullfighters, however it is this film which sees Valentino at his “scorching” best.

results.title: The Trojan women
results.brief_description: A joint Greek and American production based on Euripedes’ play “The Trojan women”. Katharine Hepburn is Hecube, the wife of King Priam; Vanessa Redgrave is Andromache, the widow of Hector; Genevieve Bujold is Cassandra, the cursed prophetess of Apollo and Trojan Princess and Irene Papas is the beautiful Helen of Troy. The victors of the Trojan war ransack the city and take as part of their spoils, the women and children. The play tells of their bitter struggle to survive the cruelty of defeat and capture.

results.title: My man Godfrey
results.creator_credit: Gregory La Cava and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This is one of the classic screwball comedies of its time. An heiress (Carole Lombard), hires a butler (William Powell) after finding him on a scavenger hunt. She and her family are under the impression that he is a tramp without a job. He decides to teach “High Society” that money isn’t everything, and in the tradition of screwball comedy gets his girl as well as making his point. The film was unsuccessful at the Academy Awards despite six nominations but remains one of the best of its genre. Based on the novel by Eric Hatch.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions, Electric Shadow Productions, ACT III Communications and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife, Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports her back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to seperate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: Serpico
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Martin Bregman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Al Pacino gives one of the screen’s great performances as Frank Serpico, a young New York cop, who is appalled by the bribery and corruption in Police Departments. Serpico refuses the many bribes which are offered him and in doing so finds himself disowned and outlawed by his colleagues to such a degree that their hostility almost costs him his life. His lone fight against corruption ultimately leads to a full-scale enquiry into police crime. Based on the book by Waldo Salt.

results.title: Once were warriors
results.creator_credit: Lee Tamahori, Robin Scholes, New Zealand On Air, Avalon Studios, New Zealand Film Commission and Communicado
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Duff’s controversial best seller, “Once Were Warriors” is an intense and powerful film that leaves audiences stunned with its uncompromising insight into the strength of Maori culture in the face of degrading urban ghettos and devastating family violence. Jake (Temuera Morrison) and Beth (Rena Owen) have been married 18 years and she still finds him irresistible. Jake is a muscular, handsome man who exudes an explosive sexual energy but spends most of the time at the pub, often proving his masculinity with his fists and regularly exploding into rages that leave terrible scars on Beth and their family.

results.title: Hotel Sorrento
results.creator_credit: Richard Franklin, Film Victoria, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Horizon Films (AU), Horizon (GB) and Bayside Pictures
results.brief_description: Hotel Sorrento is the story of three sisters who grew up in a small Australian coastal town. One is a successful writer living in London, another a businesswoman in New York, while the third remained at the family home after the death of her husband. When they are reunited after years apart, not only are fond family memories rekindled, but the unspoken feelings and unresolved tensions of past betrayal resurface. When tragedy strikes, they not only confront old wounds but discover that their lives will never be the same again. Starring Caroline Goodall, Caroline Gillmer, Tara Morice and Joan Plowright. Co-starring Ray Barrett, Nicholas Bell, Ben Thomas and John Hargreaves. Based on the stage play of the same name by Hannie Rayson.

results.title: Nikita
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Jerome Chalou, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Nikita (Anne Parillaud) is a junkie psychopath who gets life imprisonment for shooting a cop while she’s high on drugs. Whilst in prison she is given a second chance at life when she is asked to become an undercover agent for the French secret service. Within three years, after gruelling training, Nikita emerges as a superspy, a highly trained assassin, who kills effectively and emotionlessly until she falls in love … and then her world begins to crumble. Filmed with an adrenelin speed by Besson and shot in elegant colour by Thierry Arbogats, “Nikita” is a stylish thriller that breathed new life into the spy genre by its audacious use of style and art direction. From its tense beginning to the rivetting climax, “Nikita” is a non-stop rollercoaster.

results.title: The Sundowners
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Sundowners stars Deborah Kerr and Robert Mitchum as Paddy and Ida Carmody, migrant drovers who travel 400 miles of Australian outback with 1200 sheep. Despite their devotion to each other and their acceptance of the itinerant life, Ida and their son Sean yearn to settle down on a farm of their own. The Carmody’s own drama is played out against the backdrop of Australia’s startling landscapes; at one moment lush and green and in the next, stark and forbidding. This film is a a testamony to the keen eye of director Fred Zinnemann and the excellent performances of Robert Mitchum and Deborah Kerr. Based on the novel by Jon Cleary.
